team.title: TACO 4th Gen - GraphNode Team

projectIntro.title: About the Project
projectIntro.paragraph1: GraphNode is a desktop application for visualizing and managing knowledge graphs. It provides note-taking, AI chat, and graph visualization all in one platform.
projectIntro.paragraph2: Started as a TACO (Tsinghua AI and Computer Organization) 4th generation project, GraphNode aims to help users intuitively understand and manage complex knowledge structures.
projectIntro.paragraph3: Built with Electron and React, it supports cross-platform use across various operating systems.

feedback.title: Send Feedback
feedback.description: Share your opinions or suggestions about GraphNode. Your feedback helps us improve the service.
feedback.successMessage: Your feedback has been sent successfully. Thank you!
feedback.errorMessage: An error occurred while sending. Please try again.
feedback.name: Name
feedback.subject: Subject
feedback.messagePlaceholder: Please describe your feedback in detail...

guidelines.title: Feedback Guidelines
guidelines.bugReport: For bug reports, please include reproduction steps and expected behavior.
guidelines.featureSuggestion: Feature suggestions are more helpful when accompanied by specific use cases.
guidelines.reviewNotice: All feedback will be reviewed and responded to via email if necessary.

mcp.title: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
mcp.description: MCP is a protocol that allows AI assistants to extend their capabilities by connecting to external tools and data sources. When you connect an MCP server in GraphNode, AI can access file systems, databases, external APIs, and more.

customMcp.title: Create and Register Custom MCP Server
customMcp.description: To create your own MCP server, start by creating a Node.js project.

addMethod.title: How to Add Custom MCP Server
addMethod.description: You can add custom servers after enabling Settings → MCP Servers → Developer Mode.

github.title: GitHub MCP Server
github.description: MCP server for accessing GitHub repositories.
github.step1: GitHub → Settings → Developer settings → Personal access tokens

sqlite.title: SQLite Database MCP
sqlite.description: MCP for accessing local SQLite databases.

puppeteer.title: Puppeteer (Web Automation) MCP
puppeteer.description: MCP for web page scraping and automation.

api.title: API Reference
api.description: GraphNode SDK is the official client library for TypeScript/JavaScript developers. It provides cookie-based session authentication and comprehensive API coverage.
api.sdkModulesDesc: The SDK consists of 8 main modules.

me.title: User (client.me)
me.description: User-related features including profile, API keys, and language settings

graph.title: Graph (client.graph)
graph.description: Node, edge, cluster management and AI-based graph generation

restApi.title: REST API Endpoints
restApi.description: You can call REST APIs directly without the SDK. Base URL:

introPage.title: Introduction
introPage.description: GraphNode is a platform for visualizing and managing AI conversations as knowledge graphs. By understanding the context and relationships between conversations, you can gain better insights.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: GraphNode goes beyond simply storing conversations with AI assistants - it analyzes and visualizes the connections between conversations. This allows users to understand their thought patterns and explore related topics.

aiChat.title: AI Chat
aiChat.description: Chat with various AI models including OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, and DeepSeek. Streaming support allows real-time response viewing.

knowledgeGraph.title: Knowledge Graph
knowledgeGraph.description: Conversations are automatically converted to nodes, and related conversations are connected by edges. Similar topics are grouped through clustering.

mcpExtension.title: MCP Extension
mcpExtension.description: Through Model Context Protocol, AI can access external tools. Integration with GitHub, databases, file systems, and more is possible.

noteManagement.title: Note Management
noteManagement.description: Organize insights from conversations into notes and folders. Markdown is supported.

realtimeSync.title: Real-time Sync
realtimeSync.description: All data is synchronized to the cloud in real-time. Access the same data across multiple devices.

step1.title: Download App
step1.description: Download the desktop app for Windows, macOS, or Linux.

step2.title: Google Login
step2.description: Sign in with your Google account to get started.

step3.title: Start Conversation
step3.description: Select your preferred AI model and start a conversation. Conversations are automatically converted to graphs.

step4.title: Explore Graph
step4.description: Visually explore the connections between conversations in the graph view.

support.title: Support
support.description: If you encounter issues or have questions, please use the channels below.
